verses.roman:
tad-ambhasā mahā-bhāga
ātmānaṁ sa-gṛhānvayam
snāpayāṁ cakra uddharṣo
labdha-sarva-manorathaḥ

synonyms: tat—with that; ambhasā—water; mahā-bhāgaḥ—very pious; ātmānam—himself; sa—along with; gṛha—his house; anvayam—and his family; snāpayām cakre—he bathed; uddharṣaḥ—overjoyed; labdha—having attained; sarva—all; manaḥ-rathaḥ—desires.
translation: With the wash water, the virtuous Śrutadeva copiously sprinkled himself, his house and his family. Overjoyed, he felt that all his desires had now been fulfilled.
